entry.title: SAP TechEd 2025: Registration is live ‚Äì check out our brand new hybrid experience!
entry.content:
Let's take a stroll down memory lane, shall we? SAP TechEd has been with us for a long time. It's part of our DNA. It's the fabric of our community. We started small: 1 event, 1 location. Then we expanded a bit: 1 event, 3 locations. Then came the pandemic (sigh), and changing times called for changing strategies. We went completely virtual: global, accessible, flexible. We met our audience where they were. Then came (yet another) shift in the paradigm ‚Äì in-person events came back, but we still wanted to reach as many SAP fans as possible, so we created 2 events: in-person and virtual. Whew‚Ä¶that‚Äôs a lotta change!

Register here for TechEd!  

SAP TechEd goes Hybrid

This year, we are combining the best of both worlds and launching our brand-new hybrid experience for SAP TechEd in 2025. What exactly does that mean, you may ask?

It means that a full-fledged, in-person, old school SAP TechEd is back ‚Äì taking place in Berlin November 4‚Äì6 at the Messe Berlin. Yep, you read that correctly. We couldn‚Äôt be more excited! So, what exactly can you expect? You name it ‚Äì Strategy Talks, Road Map sessions, Deep Dives, Hands-on Workshops, Demo Stations and a full-blown Community Clubhouse with fan favorites like the Developer Garage and the Community Theater. Berlin is your place to connect with SAP experts, the Developer Advocates and each other IN THE FLESH! TechEd fans rejoice! No more, "Sorry, I was muted" or "Oops, could you repeat that, my connection is a bit wonky today." We‚Äôre talking real people, in a real place, with a real goal ‚Äì learning and networking. To quote one of our mentors, TechEd Berlin promises to be "an SAP Community family reunion."

What about ‚Äúhybrid‚Äù? How do the rest of us get in on the fun?

Let me explain. We'll be LIVE streaming select sessions from Berlin for our live virtual show. The sessions will be recorded and available on-demand as well. Real Berlin sessions ‚Äì live or on-demand. AND we'll have a hybrid Q&A experience - meaning our experts will be taking questions from both our live and virtual audiences. Make sense? Wait ‚Äì it gets better. We'll also have exclusive virtual segments hosted from our LIVE STUDIO right in the middle of the action on the SAP TechEd show floor in Berlin. Our roving reporters will give you a peek at what's happening throughout the venue, so our extended global community can feel like they are part of the action, right there with us. üôÇ

Tell me more! What can I learn about @SAPTechEd?

I‚Äôm so happy you asked! üòâWe have NINE tracks covering the most important technology topics our community needs to and wants to know about:

  • SAP Business Technology Platform ‚Äì General

Dive into SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP) to learn about our strategy and to dig deeper into topics that are important for your day-to-day operations on SAP BTP. You can learn how to streamline your DevOps workflows, implement security best practices, and follow strategic architecture recommendations from SAP experts. Stay ahead of the curve with the latest SAP BTP road-map information, empowering you with the knowledge and resources to drive the future of your organization.

  • Application Development and Automation

SAP Build solutions, including the ABAP Cloud model, provides what you need to build, extend, and automate applications across your landscape. From back-end services to the SAP Fiori user experience, workspaces, automations, and AI agents, you gain offerings empowered by the Joule copilot and designed to keep your core clean. Discover the latest innovations in SAP Build, explore how to develop and extend applications and processes, and learn how to create user experiences and Joule skills tailored to the way you work.

  • Integration

To ensure operational success, organizations must seamlessly integrate and automate business processes, APIs, and events across any application landscape. SAP Integration Suite empowers developers to drive innovation with an integration platform as a service (iPaaS) on SAP Business Technology Platform, which unifies on-premises and cloud-based systems, applications, events, and data. With support for event-driven architecture, the suite enables real-time responsiveness and agility by allowing systems to react instantly to business events. Discover how AI-powered capabilities in SAP Integration Suite can help harmonize user experiences and improve developer productivity and operational excellence across complex and diverse IT landscapes.

  • Data and Analytics

The future belongs to data-driven organizations. To achieve true digital transformation, organizations must access insights wherever their data resides, independent from shape or form. With data landscapes distributed among different applications and systems both in the cloud and on premises, organizations spend countless resources extracting, rebuilding, and integrating their data for their use cases. With data and analytics solutions running on SAP Business Technology Platform, organizations can build intelligent solutions, transform planning with a business data fabric, and ground and train AI with trusted data.

  • Cloud Applications

Immerse yourself in the critical suite qualities that help ensure your applications and solutions shine brightly: user experience, design, mobile apps, security, and compliance. Stay ahead with the latest trends, tools, and best practices in UX/UI design, mobile development, security protocols, and compliance frameworks. Equip yourself with the knowledge and skills to develop more secure, compliant, and user-centric solutions that not only meet but also exceed user expectations. Explore how these critical components can transform your applications into shining stars in your industry.

  • Digital Transformation with Cloud ERP

Cloud ERP supports your digital transformation with solutions for your needs. Whether you‚Äôre adopting your first ERP or migrating from an existing one, learn how Cloud ERP offers a comprehensive, modular, and extensible solution driven by built-in AI and analytics. Experience how to maximize the business value from Cloud ERP with innovative tools and AI-driven accelerators, and learn how to extend the software to create distinctive value for your organization.

  • Business AI and Joule

Make rapid, transformative business outcomes a reality, and rethink how business is done in the age of AI, accelerating your business transformation. With the Joule copilot becoming the new UI and Joule Agents reimagining how tasks are executed, we are transforming business processes from the ground up. And all of this is empowered by SAP‚Äôs unified AI operating system, which equips developers with a complement of tools and technologies to build, extend, and run custom AI solutions and agents at scale‚Äîaccessible through one single entry point.

  • Business Transformation Management

Navigate constant change with confidence by turning business transformation into a core capability. Discover how to unify enterprise architecture, business process management, and digital adoption with the latest innovations from SAP LeanIX, SAP Signavio, and WalkMe solutions. Explore agentic AI and learn how to build agents that surface insights, drive innovation, and boost efficiency. Then apply these tools to optimize processes, modernize IT, and realize business value.

  • Customer Support and Cloud Lifecycle Management

Embrace the full power of Customer Support & Cloud Lifecycle Management at SAP. Dive into the cutting-edge SAP Cloud ALM solution for application lifecycle management, master transformation tooling for the RISE with SAP and GROW with SAP journeys, and see how AI is redefining the support experience. Whether you‚Äôre building clean core landscapes, automating operations, or driving uptime with intelligence, you can gain the skills to lead with confidence and innovate with purpose.

Sounds cool! But break it down for me. How will these topics come to life?

Great question. We'll have different content formats so you can choose how you want to learn and interact. Do you like to sit back and watch the experts? Or do you prefer to get your hands "dirty" with some coding? Do you like getting insights and overviews or do you want to dive deep into a particular topic?

SAP TechEd is about so much more... and trust me ‚Äì we have so much more in store for you:

So, what's the takeaway? What's TechEd 2025 all about? 

It's about... LEARNING

It's about... CONNECTING

It's about... COMMUNITY

It's... SAP TechEd

Register today and let me know in the comments what you are looking forward to the most! I can‚Äôt WAIT to share it with all of you!

Register here for TechEd!

entry.title: A Fan Favorite is Back in Berlin: Demo Jam @SAPTechEd 2025!
entry.content:
Picture this: Your team is building something incredibly cool with SAP BTP.  Not only are you solving an actual business problem, but you‚Äôre also experimenting with new technology, trying out new features, leveraging Joule for Developers to accelerate the project and HAVING FUN while doing it.

Why not get up on stage at SAP TechEd and showcase your demo in front of an amazing crowd of SAP fans‚Ä¶ better yet, SAP friends and family.

You might have pieced it together (or read the title of this blog post) but Demo Jam is BACK! And we‚Äôre counting on you, our amazing SAP community to submit proposals to jam on stage this year in Berlin.

For those of you that are new, let‚Äôs recap what Demo Jam is:

It‚Äôs an interactive event experience with an engaging competitive element. (Because competitions are always fun, right?)

To participate you need to submit an innovative idea and bring it to life on stage in front of your peers. NO SLIDES allowed. Just REAL-LIFE DEMOS and your one-of-a-kind personality on stage, jamming like never before. You‚Äôll showcase the result of your hard work and make the audience understand why it‚Äôs so great.

Each team will have 6 minutes to present their demo in front of a live and virtual audience. Who chooses the winner? The audience of course! You‚Äôll ask them to make some noise and the winner will be declared by our trusty applause-o-meter.

Some things to consider before submitting your proposal:

  • Timing is key. You will have 6 minutes and only 6 minutes. If you go over, you will be stopped by a very annoying buzzer. And nobody likes a "buzz kill".
  • You must have a live demo. No ifs, ands or buts about it. No slides, no pictures, no videos, no AI-generated entertainment. If you don't have a demo, you can't jam.
  • Your demo should showcase how you used SAP Business Technology Platform, SAP Business Data Cloud and/or SAP Business AI to build a business use case. In other words, you need to show how you solved a business problem with SAP technology.

Let's talk details

  1. Who can participate? All SAP customers, either on their own or accompanied by an SAP partner, can submit a proposal.
  2. How can I participate? Submit your proposal with all the details here. 
  3. What happens after I submit a proposal? Our SAP experts will review the submissions and select up to 10 teams that will pitch their use case (virtually) for a spot in the Demo Jam final at SAP TechEd in Berlin.
  4. What do I need to prepare for the pitch? Anything you need to convince our SAP experts that you deserve a spot in the final! You can share your solution diagram and explain the use case, which SAP technology you will be using and anything else you think might help them understand what you plan to deliver on stage in Berlin.
  5. How many teams will be selected for the Demo Jam? Up to 6 teams will be selected for the Demo Jam final in Berlin
  6. How many team members are allowed? There is no limit on team members working on the demo, however, on stage maximum 2 team members can present the demo.
  7. Do we get SAP TechEd tickets? Each team will get 2 SAP TechEd lecture-only tickets (these can be upgraded to Full Conference tickets if available by paying the difference)
  8. Is Travel & Expense also covered for the final teams? No, T&E is NOT covered.
  9. What the timelines? The timeline overview is:

Important: Selected teams need to be available for the interview pitch from September 1 to September 5 to be considered for the final.

Looking forward to seeing all the great ideas our community wants to share!

entry.title: Become Part of the SAP TechEd Family as a Community Talk Speaker!
entry.content:
Get the chance to present in front of your peers and share your personal experience with SAP technology.

Are you an SAP BTP architect? Do you focus on building ABAP Cloud-based extensions? Are you exploring Joule for Developers across the SAP Build portfolio and have loads of insights and best practices to share?

What better chance than to do that live from the Community Theater in Berlin at this year‚Äôs SAP TechEd.

How was that for a sales' pitch? Did it work? If so, here are the details you need to know to submit your session proposal!

What you need to know

  • Community Talks are 20‚Äô sessions that can include presentations, demos, improv, props, games ‚Äì whatever you feel will get your message across.
  • This format is delivered BY the community FOR the community. Sharing experiences, providing best practices, lessons learned or just showcasing something awesome you built with SAP BTP ‚Äì everything is on the table. 
  • If your session proposal is accepted, you‚Äôll be paired with one of our Developer Advocates as your co-speaker.
  • But the fun does not stop there‚Ä¶ as a Community Talk speaker, you‚Äôll get a ‚ÄúLecture-Only‚Äù ticket to attend SAP TechEd (It can be upgraded to Full Conference pass if still available, by paying the difference).
  • Travel and Expense is not covered by SAP.

I'm in! How can I participate?

In a Nutshell

  1. Submit your proposal by Monday, July 14, 2025 at 3PM CEST
  2. By July 22 you‚Äôll receive an update on your submission status.
  3. By July 31 you'll get a notification from your Developer Advocate co-speaker
  4. By October 1 you need to submit your session material (presentation, demo recording) for review

We‚Äôll coordinate session scheduling to make sure you can hold your session and attend the sessions you want üòâ

To submit your proposal, fill out all the details here. Remember, the more you share about your proposal, the easier it will be for us to decide.

See you in Berlin!

We‚Äôre looking forward to seeing what our community brings to the stage! And of course, meeting you all at SAP TechEd in Berlin, whether on or off stage!

entry.title: Come join us for the SAP TechEd Community Cluetrain 2025 edition
entry.content:
For me, personally, SAP TechEd 2008 in Berlin, is where the Community really began for me. 
While I also attended the 2007 TechEd, TechEd 2008 in Berlin is the conference that will always be on the top of my list over unforgettable conferences attended. 

TechEd Berlin 2008 is where I met many people I still consider friends today for the first time face-to-face, the Community Clubhouse was the go-to-place, and I got to experience being on the DemoJam stage with Dick Hirsch demoing the best community-led project ever (shameless self-promotion); ESME:

If you were there in 2008, you will perhaps also recognise many faces in this video from Dennis Howlett: 


Another highlight of TechEd 2008 for me, was the SAP TechEd Cluetrain that @craigcmehil arranged. 
Since the 2025 TechEd in Berlin is all about the SAP Community coming home for me, I thought why not also relaunch the Cluetrain this year?

In 2008 we were about 25 Community members and friends who got together, and took the train together from Frankfurt to Berlin to get the conversations started. 
@gregorw published this post, and @JimSpath shared this post, about the trip. 

This year we will meet at Frankfurt Main Hbf (Frankfurt Main Central station), and take the train departing Monday, November 3rd at 13:14 CET (1:14 pm) together: 

This time we will need to try to self-coordinate buying tickets individually so that we end up sitting in the same coach. 
To start I have already booked my ticket - you will find me in coach 4, seat 91. 
When you book your tickets, please make sure you book the ticket with seat reservation and pick a seat in coach 4:

I will be at the central station about an hour before the train departs. I will add a comment on this blog post as we get closer which caf√© you can find me in. 

After arriving in Berlin, the idea is that we will all move on to attend a SAP Stammtisch together. 
Our Berlin group owner, @rofinke, is out on vacation right now, so time and place is still to be announced. 
@rofinke - FYI for when you are back, we will host a Stammtisch together on November 3rd üòÅ  (please check your private messages when you are back online)

Big shout out to @gregorw - as always, thank you for your support!

I will end this post with the same shoutout that Craig did in 2008:
Several hundred kilometers of conversation, community, collaboration and co-innovation! 
I hope to see many of you on the train üôÇ
(if you book a ticket, let us know by adding a comment below)

  • SAP TechEd registration is now live, you can read more about it here.
  • DemoJam is back this year as well, check out this post from @cecihuergo 
  • Aaaand the Community Talks are back as well

#sapcommunityiscominghome ü•≥

entry.title: Share Your SAP Signavio Story at SAP TechEd: Become a Community Talk Speaker!
entry.content:
Are you working on technical innovations, integrations, or solutions that connect SAP Signavio with the broader SAP ecosystem? Why not share your story on one of SAP‚Äôs biggest stages ‚Äî and become an ambassador for SAP Signavio in the TechEd community? 

SAP TechEd is returning this year ‚Äî and so is the opportunity for YOU to step into the spotlight as a Community Talk speaker! 

What Are Community Talks? 

Community Talks are short, 20-minute sessions where SAP customers, partners, and experts share practical experiences, technical solutions, and innovative ideas. It‚Äôs your chance not only to showcase your expertise but also to educate and inspire peers eager to learn how SAP technologies connect in real-world scenarios. 

Imagine using this platform to: 

‚úÖAdvocate for how SAP Signavio can be integrated with SAP BTP 

‚úÖShow how to build extensions or analytics solutions that leverage process insights 

‚úÖShare how to automate business processes based on SAP Signavio findings 

‚úÖDiscuss technical lessons learned during SAP S/4HANA migrations 

‚úÖExplore security, governance, or architecture best practices 

These sessions are casual, engaging, and designed for lively discussions rather than long lectures. 

‚ÄúMy Community Talk at SAP TechEd helped me connect with peers who were facing the same challenges. It felt great to share our Signavio journey and get instant feedback.‚Äù 
‚Äî Past Community Talk Speaker 

Why Should You Apply? 

  • Be an Ambassador: Represent SAP Signavio at TechEd and raise awareness of its power and technical possibilities. 
  • Visibility: Present at SAP‚Äôs premier technical event and grow your professional profile. 
  • Networking: Connect with other practitioners, experts, and innovators. 
  • Impact: Help others learn from your experiences and spark new ideas across the community. 

Even if you‚Äôre not a seasoned speaker, don‚Äôt worry ‚Äî the SAP Community team will support you along the way. Every selected speaker will be paired with an SAP Developer Advocate to help prepare your talk. 

Key Dates You Need to Know 

If you‚Äôre considering becoming a Community Talk speaker, here‚Äôs your roadmap: 

How to Get Involved 

üëâSubmit your proposal here: Become a Community Talk Speaker at SAP TechEd 

For more details about this year‚Äôs opportunity, check out the official SAP Community blog: 
üëâBecome Part of the SAP TechEd Family as a Community Talk Speaker 

The call for proposals is open now, and spots are limited, so don‚Äôt wait too long to share your idea! 

Whether your story is about integrating SAP Signavio with other SAP solutions, developing innovative technical use cases, or overcoming challenges in your projects, the SAP community wants to hear from you. 

Seize the chance to be an ambassador for SAP Signavio ‚Äî and help educate and inspire the SAP TechEd community. We can‚Äôt wait to see your ideas come to life on stage! 

Ready to inspire and connect? Apply today.

entry.title: SAP Developer News 17th July, 2025
entry.content:
Developer News ‚Äì Highlights

SAP Joule Studio Released

  • Michael Ameling Blog: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/joule-studio-is-generally-available-in-sap-build-empower-your-business-with/ba-p/14137882

  • Maria Kondretyeva Blog: https://community.sap.com/t5/application-development-and-automation-blog-posts/how-to-get-started-with-joule-studio/ba-p/14152855

  • Video Overview: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JdwfjieiOFY

  • Video Tutorial: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0bH3CMpKCIg

  • Developer Tutorial Set: https://developers.sap.com/group.joule-studio-first-skill.html

  • Product Tour Click-Through: https://url.sap/product-tour

Sneak Peek: SAP Analytics Cloud Q3 2025 & Best Practices

  • Sneak Peek Q3 Release: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/sneak-peek-in-to-sap-analytics-cloud-release-for-q3-2025/ba-p/14153017

  • Best Practices: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/sap-analytics-cloud-best-practices/ba-p/14051467

  • Templates Best Practices: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/sap-analytics-cloud-templates-best-practices/ba-p/14033472

SAPUI5/OpenUI5 1.136.x ‚Äì Legacy-Free Update

  • Explore the Update: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/explore-sapui5-openui5-1-136-x-legacy-free/ba-p/14103271

Integration Suite India Roadshow

  • Roadshow Blog: https://community.sap.com/t5/sap-codejam-blog-posts/sap-integration-suite-codejam-roadshow-in-india/ba-p/14110730

  • How to Host a CodeJam: https://community.sap.com/t5/sap-codejam-blog-posts/so-you-want-to-host-a-codejam-everything-you-need-to-know/ba-p/221415

SAP TechEd 2025 Berlin ‚Äì Session Catalog Live

  • Session Catalog: https://www.sap.com/events/teched/berlin/flow/sap/te25/catalog-inperson/page/catalog

Application Frontend Service

  • Intro Blog: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/introducing-application-frontend-service/ba-p/14091408

  • Simple UI Applications Guide: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/simple-ui-applications-with-application-frontend-service/ba-p/14096009

  • SAP Help Portal Documentation: https://help.sap.com/docs/application-frontend-service/application-frontend-service/what-is-application-frontend-service?version=Cloud

  • Setup in SAP BTP Trial: https://help.sap.com/docs/application-frontend-service/application-frontend-service/setup-in-sap-btp-trial

  • GitHub Samples: https://github.com/SAP-samples/multi-cloud-html5-apps-samples

  • Now GA in SAP BTP Trial: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/application-frontend-service-now-generally-available-in-sap-btp-trail/ba-p/14134649

What‚Äôs New in SAP BTP ‚Äì Q2 2025

  • Blog Post: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/what-s-new-in-sap-btp-q2-2025/ba-p/14145899

Chapter Titles

0:00 Intro
0:09 SAP Joule Studio Released
2:30 Sneak Peek: SAP Analytics Cloud Q3 Release & Best Practices
3:16 SAPUI5/OpenUI5 Goes Legacy-Free
3:51 SAP Integration Suite India Roadshow
5:51 SAP TechEd Berlin - Session Catalo
6:51 Application Frontend Service
8:21 What's New in SAP BTP ‚Äì Q2 2025

Transcription 

[Intro] This is the SAP Developer News for July the 17th, 2025.

[Daniel] Big news this week, Joule Studio was released. Joule Studio is the new tool within SAP Build that lets you create your own custom skills for Joule. In other words, you can define what prompts Joule responds to and also define the messages and data to display in response to those prompts. Michael Ameling, president of BTP, announced the release in his blog. Maria Kantroncheva, a product manager, also wrote a blog about the details of the commercial model and what landscapes you can install Joule Studio on. Here she is in an exclusive interview with Developer News describing some of the capabilities.

So you can start building your own custom Joule skills by bringing any application or any data service or any system transactions to your Joule. In addition, a set of learning materials were released so you can start creating Joule skills. First, there was a product tour click-through where you can see the UI and some of the key capabilities. A video was released showing you step -by-step how to create your first skill. And a set of very detailed tutorials were released within the developer tutorial area that shows you how to create skills, including several different skills, so you can see how to use processes and actions within your skills. Michael, Maria, and Miguel Meza -Martinez, another product manager, also described how agents will soon be added to the things that you can create within Joule Studio. Here is Miguel talking about those plans.

[Miguel] Hi, everyone. I'm thrilled to announce that Joule Studio Skill Builder is now generally available. You can finally make Joule your jewel. But this is just the beginning. Please stay tuned for AI agent capabilities coming to Joule Studio later this year.

[Daniel] I will leave links to the videos, to the blogs, to the click-through tour, and to the tutorials in the description.

[Witalij] Summary, AI-assisted commenting, say AI again, I dare you, I double dare you, okay, okay, okay let me talk about dashboard design best practices then. As a part of this series of blog posts the new one has been published and it is focused on template types, layout settings, theming and so on. Links are in the description.

[Nico] Hi everyone and welcome to the SAP Developer News. The UI5 team just recently published the legacy free version of SAPUI5 and OpenUI5 which can now test and check out. They removed all the deprecated code and APIs and it includes the modular bootstrap for example which increases performance and it's now ready for you to test out. Do not use it in production rather use it in development to make sure your UI5 apps are future proof. Check out the link in the description for more information and hope to talk to you soon. Bye.

[Antonio and Ajay] Hola, SAP developers. So it's been an eventful week. You know, we've been running quite a few CodeJams this week, all focusing on SAP Integration Suite, right? So we've been running CodeJams. I started in Madrid and then in Abu Dhabi. And then, well, now we are here in India, but all CodeJams actually took place in India. So tell us a bit more about the CodeJams in India. Yeah, so we had quite a lot of CodeJam we already did, starting on Monday, where we had our first CodeJam in Colgate in Mumbai. And then it was followed by the second CodeJam that we had in Hyderabad. So we flew to Hyderabad and we had the second CodeJam related to Advanced Event Mesh at Hyderabad Mindset. And yesterday we had it in Infosys campus and again it was the Advanced Event Mesh Integration Suite CodeJam that we ran there and today we are here in SAP Bangalore SAP Labs Bangalore doing event -driven processes in SAP Build Process Automation and tomorrow we are going to Pineset and we will do a Code Jam there connecting systems and services using Integration Suite. So what else, Antonio? Well, it's a pretty packed week, I would say. So yeah, just remember that you can obviously request CodeJams via the SAP Community website. Just visit the SAP CodeJams group. And all the details there and all the different topics that we do as CodeJams are also listed there. So do check it out. And remember, CodeJams are a great, easy way to get familiar with different SAP BTP technologies. so looking forward to meeting you in a future CodeJam. yeah bye

[Rich] Hey folks Rich Heilman here. I hope everyone is doing well i just wanted to pop on here and let you all know that the session catalog is now live for SAP TechEd 2025 in Berlin the teams are working really hard to bring back the magic of TechEds of the past and that includes great content from our SAP experts from the catalog you can filter down the sessions by track session type session experience level and others you can browse deep dive sessions hands-on workshops roadmaps and strategy talks and click to add them to your favorites this is also the same place where you'll be able to reserve your seats for hands-on workshops when that piece goes live. We are all really excited to get everyone back together and bring everyone home in Berlin. So check out the session catalog, see what we have to offer this year, and register today. And we'll see you in Berlin. Bye for now.

[Thomas] In this news segment, I'd like to talk to you about the Application Front-end Service. It's a relatively new service offering in SAP BTP. It's only been available for a couple of months. It is a service that is designed to help you with building the deployment and the managing of the front end portions of your application. So it can help you deploy your SAPUI5 Fiori applications in conjunction with ABAP or CAP backends. Now it's very similar to the functionality provided by both the application router and if you've ever used it the HTML5 repository in the old Neo environment. In fact, it wants to deliver many of the same features and capabilities, but do so in a centralized managed service so you're not having to deal with the infrastructure deployment of each application that you want to host a front end for. It has both command line and tooling integrated into the development environment, such as BaaS or a web-based console to help you with deploying your applications. You can also deploy it as part of a MTA, a multi-target application. But the best news probably is that it is now available as part of the SAP BTP trial. So if you're curious about the application front-end service. Try it out today for free in the BTP trial.

[Mamikee] The latest Q2 2025 update for SAP BTP is now available, bringing exciting improvements across development, integration, analytics, and more. Some key highlights include application development and automation, which enhances tools for faster app building in the Cloud Foundry environment. Integration services, which updates to SAP's connectivity authorization and trust management and the audit log service, analytics and data management with new services and expanded support in data handling. This release continues SAP's BTP mission to unify database, AI, analytics, development automation, and integration seamlessly. Straight from SAP's foundation to today's cloud -native powerhouse. If you're building on BTP, these updates are designed to make your work smoother, smarter, and faster. You can read more in the description.

entry.title: Top 3 reasons to attend SAP TechEd 2025 in Berlin
entry.content:
After years of digital conferences and small-scale substitutes, SAP TechEd is finally returning to the big stage again!

As someone who literally owes his career to SAP TechEd (more on that later!), I couldn't be more excited about this revival. From my first attendance as a participant to eventually taking the stage as a speaker and ultimately becoming an SAP Mentor, TechEd has been the kickstarter of my professional journey in the SAP ecosystem.

While the virtual editions of TechEd during the pandemic served their purpose, there's something magical about in-person events that even the best-produced, high-definition streaming experience cannot match or replace.

Let me share my top three reasons why you should go for the in-person attendance rather than joining SAP TechEd virtually.

1. Let's re-ignite the community

There's a certain atmosphere to it when thousands of SAP enthusiasts gather under one roof. I still remember my first TechEd as an introvert techie, anxiously navigating through crowds, business card in hand, unsure of whom to talk to. Fast forward a few years, and those initial awkward conversations have transformed into meaningful professional relationships that would shape my career trajectory.

The SAP community is more than just a professional network; for many of us, there's a 'family reunion' flavor to it every time we meet. The spontaneous conversations in hallways, the animated discussions over coffee, and the passionate debates during evening events - these are the moments when we truly connect and 'evil plans' are sketched out. These are the interactions that eventually transform an introverted techie into a more well-rounded IT professional with a global network (anyone else?)

As we emerge from years of virtual-only connections, NOW we have the opportunity to switch back to authentic human interaction. The community needs to reconnect to share common challenges, best practices, and lessons learned.

Don't miss out on this opportunity to be part of this community reunion, and let's re-ignite the community spirit.

2. Embrace Continuous Learning

We live in interesting times, and with a hat-tip to William Gibson, may I say that we all have the privilege to experience the future firsthand?!?

GenAI is fundamentally altering the art of the possible in enterprise software, and by extension, every business function and professional role. At this pivotal moment, staying on the sidelines is not an option for anyone interested in pursuing a career in the SAP ecosystem.

At TechEd Berlin, you'll be able to touch, test, and truly understand the impact of genAI innovations in a way that's impossible through virtual attendance. The hands-on labs, expert-guided sessions, and interactive workshops provide an immersive learning environment that simply can't be replicated online.

Throughout my career in the SAP ecosystem, from working on the founding team behind SAP's cloud platform (now SAP BTP) to my current role focusing on business innovation, I've witnessed how being present at these pivotal technology inflection points provides an invaluable advantage. The questions you can ask in real-time, the nuances you can observe in demonstrations, and the collaborative problem-solving that happens spontaneously - these are the moments when it truly "clicks".

3. Boost Your Career: Grow Your Network, Expand Your Horizon

When I say "I owe my career to SAP TechEd", it's not (just) because I'm a fanboy (OK, I am) or because I drank too much cool-aid; it's true. My professional journey wouldn't have been the same without TechEd. The connections I made and the visibility I gained through presenting technical sessions paved the way to roles I never imagined possible: from becoming an evangelist for SAP Cloud Platform to joining the ranks of the SAP Mentors, it's all connected to TechEd.

Being in Berlin will put you at the pulse of what's happening in the SAP ecosystem. You'll meet the people making decisions about the future of SAP technologies. You'll connect with peers facing similar challenges across industries. You'll encounter potential employers, employees, mentors, and mentees.

A casual conversation might lead to your next career move. A question during a session might identify you as a subject matter expert to someone who needs your skills. Your thoughtful contribution to a discussion might catch the attention of a community leader looking for new voices. The relationships you build and nurture at in-person events like TechEd provide a professional support system that can guide you through career transitions, technical challenges, and professional growth opportunities for years to come.

Make a career-defining choice

While the virtual TechEd experience offers valuable content accessibility, the in-person event delivers something far more profound: a transformative experience that can reshape your career trajectory and professional identity within the SAP ecosystem.

I'm looking forward to Berlin this November, ready to reconnect with old friends and make new ones. I'd love to see as many of you there as possible. Are you in?

If you're ready to go, please register now for SAP TechEd Berlin and tell/bring a friend!

For all those who already booked your trip - I'm curious:

What are your reasons, and what are you most looking forward to? Please share your thoughts!

entry.title: Get Ready for SAP TechEd 2025: Explore the Learning Zone and Join the Devtoberfest Celebration!
entry.content:
Calling all developers, learners, and SAP tech enthusiasts! As SAP TechEd in 2025 approaches, it‚Äôs the perfect time to sharpen your skills and connect with the global SAP community.

 

SAP TechEd 2025 ‚Äì Learning Zone is now live

Whether you're looking to build new skills, prepare for certification, or dive into the latest SAP innovations, the Learning Zone has everything you need ‚Äì and it's all available before the main event kicks off on November 4.

 

And there‚Äôs more: SAP TechEd 2025 session catalog is now available
Browse the full list of sessions (Berlin | Virtual), explore key topics, and save your favorites to build a personalized agenda for an unforgettable learning experience.

 

What‚Äôs waiting for you in the Learning Zone?

Explore 40+ interactive value journeys and solution showcases to discover the power of SAP technologies.

Upskill with 30+ free, self-paced learning journeys aligned to SAP TechEd content tracks ‚Äì curated to help you master topics that matter and prepare for your SAP Certification exam.

Try out 35+ SAP demos and 30+ real-world use cases, giving you hands-on experience with the tools that drive enterprise transformation.

üëâExplore learning opportunities for each SAP TechEd 2025 track:

  • SAP Business Technology Platform - General
  • Application development and automation
  • Integration
  • Data and analytics
  • Cloud applications
  • Digital transformation with cloud ERP
  • Business AI and Joule
  • Customer support and cloud lifecycle management
  • Business transformation management

Now is the time to boost your skills, prepare for your SAP TechEd experience, and become future-ready.

 

Devtoberfest by SAP TechEd returns: September 29 ‚Äì October 24, 2025

We are also thrilled to announce the return of Devtoberfest by SAP TechEd ‚Äì the coding-focused celebration from developers for developers.

Devtoberfest is a multi-week event packed with fun, learning, and collaboration for SAP developers around the world. From September 29 to October 24, join thousands of fellow developers in a virtual festival-like experience that combines:

Learning through building ‚Äì Hands-on tutorials, technical sessions, and challenges across SAP technologies.

Flexible participation ‚Äì Join when it suits your schedule and earn points for everything you complete.

Community and connection ‚Äì Collaborate with other developers and celebrate your love for coding.

Devtoberfest is more than just an event ‚Äì it‚Äôs a celebration of what makes us developers: coding and collaboration.

 

 

So what are you waiting for?

üåêJump into the SAP TechEd Learning Zone

üéâSave the date for Devtoberfest by SAP TechEd in 2025

 

Start learning, building, and celebrating today ‚Äì and we‚Äôll see you at SAP TechEd 2025!

entry.title: Why I'm Attending SAP TechEd 2025 Virtually and Top Picks
entry.content:
If you are an SAP fan like me, you know that SAP TechEd is the place to be. As always, it is packed with innovation, insights, and forward-thinking sessions.  Whether you are into SAP Integration Suite wizardry, BTP magic, or just geeking out over the latest in AI, cloud, and developer tools‚Äîthis is our Super Bowl. 

This year, you can build AI agents with Joule and SAP AI services, unlock real-time insights with SAP Business Data Cloud, automate smarter with SAP‚Äôs full developer toolchain, and modernize fast using SAP Integration Suite. Plus, it‚Äôs an amazing chance to connect with the global dev community that's shaping what‚Äôs next for the SAP ecosystem.

This year, I‚Äôm attending virtually‚Äîand no, it‚Äôs not because I‚Äôm afraid of airport security or can‚Äôt find my suitcase (okay‚Ä¶ maybe just a little). It's because SAP TechEd virtual is packed with value, zero travel hassle, and 100% flexibility.

Here‚Äôs why I'm fired up for the virtual experience:

Access to World-Class Content

From keynote deep dives to strategy talks and road maps, SAP TechEd brings cutting-edge topics to your screen‚Äîincluding AI, BTP, S/4HANA, and low-code/no-code development. And yes, you can pause the session to refill your coffee. Try doing that at an in-person keynote!

It is Built for Builders
Whether you‚Äôre a developer, architect, or just SAP-curious, the virtual platform is designed to help you dig deep. Personalized tracks, live chats, and digital networking‚Äîit‚Äôs all there. 

On Your Schedule
No need to block out travel days or rearrange your week. Attend sessions live or catch replays when it works for you. Your future SAP knowledge base will thank you.

Did I mention it‚Äôs FREE?
No flights, no hotels, no expenses. Just you, your device, and an all-access pass to SAP‚Äôs most important tech event of the year.

My SAP TechEd top picks

This year, I‚Äôm especially excited about sessions that show how AI is not just a buzzword‚Äîbut a real accelerator for consultants, developers, and users alike. Here are my top 3 picks you won‚Äôt want to miss:

1.- ST123v | Transforming how people work with Joule technology
Explore how upcoming innovations, third-party integrations, and customization options from Joule are changing the way we interact with SAP. Get insider insights into what‚Äôs powering the new agentic AI UI‚Äîand how it‚Äôs reshaping user experiences. AI is no longer the future‚Äîit's the co-pilot of the present.

2.- AD820v | Future of app dev in SAP Build: Simplifying clean core and LoB extensions
See what‚Äôs next for SAP Build: enhanced pro developer tools, deeper Joule integration, and improved extensibility for LoB apps. All designed to support clean core principles and boost developer productivity.

3.- ST112v | AI and the Future of Product and UX on Web and Mobile
Joule isn‚Äôt just for consultants‚Äîit‚Äôs transforming the user experience too. This session dives into how embedded AI is enhancing UX for SAP Business Suite. Whether you're designing mobile apps or web interfaces, you'll see how users are getting more relevant, more personalized, and more intuitive experiences‚Äîand how you can be part of creating them.

So if you're thinking of joining‚Äîstop thinking and just register now üëâhttps://www.sap.com/events/teched/berlin.html

 

See you (virtually) at TechEd! üòâ

entry.title: Demo Jam @ SAP TechEd On Tour Bangalore | Nov 25‚Äì26, 2025 | BIEC
entry.content:
Bring Your Ideas to Life 

The wait is over ‚Äì Demo Jam is back at SAP TechEd On Tour, happening on November 25‚Äì26 in Bangalore! This is your chance to wow customers and partners in the audience, showcase your most innovative SAP-powered solution, and prove your skills in a high-energy live showdown. 

What‚Äôs SAP Demo Jam? 

Think of it as the ultimate live demo battle - no slides, no filler. Just six minutes of pure creativity and innovation, live on stage. The winner? Chosen by the audience using our applause-o-meter. 
(Need ideas? Check out the 2023 SAP DemoJam Highlights.) 

Rules 

  • Time Limit: Exactly 6 minutes - go over and the buzzer cuts you off.
  • Live Demo Only: No PPTs, no screenshots, no videos, no AI-generated entertainment -only real, working solutions.
  • Tech Focus: Must show how you used SAP BTP (incl. SAP Build, APAB, SAP Integration Suite, HANA Cloud), SAP Business Data Cloud, and/or SAP Business AI to solve a real business problem.
  • Team Size: 2 presenters on stage.

How to Submit Your Proposal 

Email TechEdonTourBangalore2025@sap.com

Subject : SAP Demo Jam - SAP TechEd On Tour Bangalore 2025 

Details : 

  • Name of your demo 
  • Detailed description of your demo 
  • Business value you‚Äôre demonstrating (max 500 words) 
  • Technology used 
  • Presenter #1: Name, Email, Company, Job profile 
  • Presenter #2: Name, Email, Company, Job profile 
  • (Optional) Link to a short demo video 

Deadline: September 22, 2025 

What Happens Next? 

  • Selection of Finalists: Six teams will be chosen by an SAP expert panel and announced on October 3rd, 2025. 
  • Complimentary Tickets: Finalist presenters get complimentary SAP TechEd On Tour Bangalore tickets (travel & expenses not included). 
  • Live Demo: On November 26, finalists take the stage-two presenters per team-to battle it outlive.

Bring your ideas. Bring your energy. Bring your innovation. 

Let‚Äôs Jam, Bangalore!

entry.title: Meet SAP TechEd Community Speaker Marla Alschweiki
entry.content:
If you are traveling to Berlin, I hope you will make time to join Marla's community session.

CT1245 | Hugging Face Transformers in AI Foundation

Community Talk

Learn how to deploy Hugging Face Transformers in SAP AI Core, manage them via SAP AI Launchpad, and connect them to SAP apps like SAP Fiori or SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP). This session shares architecture, tips, and real-world use cases for bringing custom NLP models into AI Foundation on SAP Business Technology Platform.

SAP TechEd Berlin - Session Catalog

Get to know Marla:
Marla is a Senior Data and AI Development Consultant with a strong curiosity and a passion for learning. Her current areas of expertise and interest are in SAP AI, machine learning, and data analytics.  She specializes in integrating AI capabilities into SAP systems, creating innovative and practical solutions for real-world enterprises needs.

Hobbies & Interests:
Outside of work, Marla likes to stay active and do some sport, learning languages (currently French), and spend time with her little puppy Carlo. 

Marla and Carlo

Why Attend Marla's Session:
At SAP TechEd, Marla will be presenting a session on leveraging Hugging Face Transformers in the SAP AI Foundation. She‚Äôll explore how to bring cutting-edge NLP models into SAP BTP, deploy them seamlessly in SAP AI Core, manage them efficiently with AI Launchpad, and connect them to SAP apps like Fiori or CAP , Along the way, you might even pick up a few insider tips for confidently navigating Hugging Face like a pro.

I hope you make time for Marla's session.

entry.title: ABAP Cloud Sessions at SAP TechEd in 2025
entry.content:
Hey Everyone!

SAP TechEd in 2025 kicks off on the 4th of November 2025, and preparations are now in full swing at SAP!

SAP TechEd is the leading tech conference for all developers, IT professionals, business experts, tech visionaries, innovators, and leaders eager to gain in-depth knowledge of SAP‚Äôs solutions, platforms, and technologies, along with insights into their future direction. It also offer an opportunity to network and connect with peers and SAP experts. 

In 2025, SAP TechEd goes hybrid, kicking off with parallel events in Berlin, Louisville, and online ‚Äì followed by SAP TechEd on Tour stops in Australia, India, UK, and Germany for a unique opportunity for an in-depth, in-person learning experience. Except for the Berlin and Bangalore stops, the on-site events are organized in partnership with, and hosted by, SAP User Groups and SAPinsider. 

The choice is yours: join us on-site in Berlin or Louisville (at ASUG Tech Connect), or online for the first events in the series! 

Save the date and register now!
üìÖNovember 4 - 6, 2025
Berlin | Virtual (free of charge) | Louisville

ABAP Cloud at SAP TechEd in 2025

üîß What to Expect

ABAP continues to evolve, and SAP TechEd events in 2025 are the best place to see what‚Äôs next. Beyond the integration of ABAP Cloud into SAP Build announced last year, and the integration of SAP Joule for Developers into the ABAP development tools along with the ABAP AI SK to infuse AI into your business processes earlier this year,  you‚Äôll have the opportunity to explore the latest innovations and updates in ABAP Cloud, AI-based custom code transformation, clean core practices, and the new clean core levels approach for SAP S/4HANA extensibility in both the private cloud and on-premise.

üí° Why Attending ABAP Sessions Matters

  • Get a clear direction for your ABAP strategy, whether you're on ECC, S/4HANA, or SAP BTP
  • Learn how to modernize custom development without touching the core
  • See how SAP Joule for Developers, ABAP AI capabilities can support faster, cleaner development
  • Take home practical skills for RAP, testing, ABAP Test Cockpit, governance, and more

Access the SAP TechEd 2025 session catalogs:  SAP TechEd Berlin | SAP TechEd Virtual | ASUG Tech Connect.

ABAP Cloud Sessions at SAP TechEd Berlin 2025 

üìÖ Event Info: 

  • Dates: November 4‚Äì6, 2025
  • Location: Messe Berlin (Berlin, Germany)
  • Session formats: Strategy talks, roadmap updates, deep dives, community talks, and hands-on workshops
  • 9 Content tracks: ABAP sessions primarily in the tracks "Application Development & Automation (AD)" and "Digital Transformation with Cloud ERP (DT)" 

üé§Keynote

KEY100 | Beyond the hype: How SAP is supercharging developers for what's next
Some experts argue there‚Äôs a developer shortage. Others will say developers are no longer needed due to AI. Let‚Äôs get real: developers, architects, and technologists are here to stay, and their roles are more important than ever. Explore how the latest technology, tools, AI, agents, and learning from SAP can help you adapt these changing roles. 

üéØStrategy Talks (25 minutes)

ST109 ‚Äì SAP Build: ABAP Cloud Strategy | also available virtually as ST119v
The ABAP Cloud strategy as part of SAP Build and the SAP strategy go hand-in-hand. Explore in this session what this means for our major topics ABAP AI and Custom Code Transformation and how we integrate Business Data Cloud. Furthermore, learn about the ABAP IDE strategy and how we support the sovereign cloud.
Speakers: Sonja Li√©nard (SAP), Boris Gebhardt (SAP)

ST113 ‚Äì Journey to unified extensibility in SAP Business Suite and cloud ERP
Explore the strategy for extensibility across SAP Business Suite and cloud ERP. Learn why AI-driven development with the SAP Build solution including ABAP Cloud is key, and how the planned harmonization will make it easier to build extensions and support the clean core. Furthermore, learn about opportunities for partners to extend SAP solutions.
Speakers: Boris Gebhardt (SAP), Khaled Musilhy (SAP), tbd

üó∫Ô∏è Roadmap Sessions (25 minutes)

AD808 ‚Äì SAP Build: ABAP Cloud road map
See our upcoming innovations for the ABAP Cloud development model including Joule and the Business Data Cloud integration in context and get updates on the roadmap ahead.
Speakers: Boris Gebhardt (SAP)

DT814 ‚Äì Extensibility innovations road map for SAP Business Suite and cloud ERP
Explore upcoming extensibility innovations for SAP Business Suite and cloud ERP. Discover road maps for suite extensibility, harmonization, and partner enablement for commercial use cases. Learn more about upcoming innovations for AI-driven extensibility with the SAP Build solution including ABAP Cloud to support your clean core strategy.
Speakers: Oren Shatil (SAP), Boris Gebhardt (SAP), External Speaker

üîçDeep Dives (45 minutes)

AD104 ‚Äì Boost your  ABAP development with Joule for developers  | also available virtually as AD104v
In this deep dive session you will learn all aspects of the ABAP AI strategy, from accelerating your ABAP development, over developing custom AI scenarios, up to using Joule to transform your ABAP code.
Speakers: Simona Marincei (SAP), Olga Dolinskaja (SAP)

AD105 ‚Äì Introduction to ABAP Cloud and how to get started 
ABAP Cloud is the new way of developing ABAP‚Äîfully cloud-enabled and driven by AI. It combines cloud technologies with a clear separation of SAP and custom code, and in this way revolutionizes ABAP development. Grasp the major concepts of ABAP Cloud and learn how you can upskill. Also learn about Bosch Digital‚Äôs journey to ABAP Cloud and clean core.
Speakers: Carine Tchoutouo Djomo (SAP), Ajay Kulkarni (Robert Bosch GmbH)

AD201 ‚Äì Explore ABAP Cloud in SAP Build - what's in for ABAP developers?   
In this deep dive we will highlight the importance of our strategic approach of integrating ABAP Cloud in SAP Build. Learn how you can benefit from this for Fiori App development and how the graphical modeler helps you to create ABAP CDS models conveniently. Finally, get insights into the future direction.
Speakers: Dr. Anne Keller (SAP), Katja Zoch (SAP)

DT200 ‚Äì Unravel the mysteries of Clean Core extensions in Cloud ERP Private 
Learn about the new, enhanced clean core extensibility concept in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition. Learn about tools like ABAP Test Cockpit and RISE Dashboard, as well as guidance and best practices that help you to measure, govern, re-factor and develop your custom extensions in a clean core compliant, upgrade stable and cloud-ready way.
Speakers: Olga Dolinskaja (SAP), Markus Goebel (SAP)

DT201 ‚Äì Extensibility with ABAP Cloud and AI in SAP Cloud ERP
Learn about the on-stack key user and developer tools in the ABAP Cloud development model, now enhanced with generative AI. See how you can extend standard SAP applications and manage your custom apps directly in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. Get insights into latest innovations for transactional, analytical, and integration use cases, such as the extensibility AI Assistant, editable tree-views, custom queries for analytical SAP Fiori apps, ABAP SQL services and more.
Speakers: Carine Tchoutouo Djomo (SAP), Oren Shatil (SAP)

üõ†Ô∏è Hands-On Workshops (2 hours)

AD162 ‚Äì Explore Joule for developers, ABAP AI capabilities    
Learn how to develop a RAP business object while exploring Joule's ABAP AI capabilities
Speakers: Sebastian Baskovich (SAP), Thomas Alexander Ritter (SAP), Dr. Anne Keller (SAP), Simona Marincei (SAP)

AD163 ‚Äì Fusion Development with ABAP Cloud in SAP Build
In this session we will practice fusion development of ABAP Cloud in SAP Build by creating an ABAP Cloud project from the SAP Build lobby to develop a RAP BO including a Fiori application on top.
Speakers: Ingo Br√§uninger (SAP), Sebastian Baskovich (SAP), Anne Keller (SAP), Katja Zoch (SAP)

AD164 ‚Äì Get started with ABAP Cloud for classic ABAP developers    
Familiar with classic ABAP development? Join us to learn how similar development works with ABAP Cloud development model using the ABAP RESTful application programming model (RAP). ABAP Cloud is the comprehensive model for building cloud-ready business apps, services, and extensions that follow clean core principles by default ‚Äì on SAP BTP and SAP S/4HANA, both in the cloud and on-premise.
Speakers: Volker Drees (SAP), Carine Tchoutouo Djomo (SAP), Boris Gebhardt (SAP), J√ºrgen Reidl (SAP)

DT260 ‚Äì Modernize classic extensions to clean core in Cloud ERP Private    
In this session you will practice a clean core extensibility in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition. You will learn how to govern clean core development using the ABAP Test Cockpit, and how to use ABAP Cloud and clean core extensibility principles to modernize your custom on-stack extensions.
Speakers: Ingo Br√§uninger (SAP), Olga Dolinskaja (SAP), Thomas Fiedler (SAP), Markus Goebel (SAP)

DT261 ‚Äì Build on-stack extensions with ABAP Cloud in Cloud ERP Public
Join us to discover how to build extensions, applications, and services with the ABAP Cloud development model, using the ABAP RESTful application programming model and generative AI. You will learn how to extend standard SAP applications, consume public SAP APIs, and build new apps and services from scratch. Get practical insights through exercises and take the opportunity to ask your questions.
Speakers: Ingo Br√§uninger (SAP), Carine Tchoutouo Djomo (SAP), Volker Drees (SAP), Steffen Mattes (SAP)

DT266 ‚Äì Troubleshoot and Optimize ABAP Cloud Extensions in Cloud ERP 
Ensuring optimal performance and stability of your ABAP Cloud-based extensions is crucial to long-term success. Learn advanced techniques and best practices for troubleshooting and optimizing custom code in the Cloud ERP. Use powerful tools like ABAP Cross Trace to get deep insights into execution flows and resource consumption.
Speakers: Steffen Mattes (SAP), Juergen Reidl (SAP), Thomas Alexander Ritter (SAP), Thomas Fiedler (SAP)

üëãJoin Us

I hope this overview gives you even more reasons to join us at one of the SAP TechEd 2025 tour stops in Berlin (DE), Louisville (US), Sydney (AU), Bangalore (IN), Birmingham (UK), or Hamburg (DE) ‚Äì or attend online, free of charge!

We look forward to meeting and interacting with you! ü§ù  In the meantime, you can watch the replays of last year's events: ABAP Cloud at SAP TechEd Virtual 2024 and ABAP Cloud at SAP's Devtoberfest in 2024. You can also have a look at the üî•ABAP Cloud sessions at the upcoming Devtoberfest 2025, running online and free of charge from September 29 to October 24, 2025! ü§ù

Stay tuned ‚Äì and see you there!
